meanings.definition: To officially take out of service or use
meanings.sent1: The old ship was decommissioned and no longer sailed the seas.
meanings.sent2: The government decided to decommission the outdated power plant.
meanings.sent3: The decommissioned robot found a new purpose as a metal sculpture in the park.
meanings.sent4: After years of loyal service, the decommissioned fire truck rested in the museum.
meanings.sent5: The decision to decommission the playground equipment left the children disappointed.

meanings.definition: The act of decommissioning, especially in regards to military equipment or nuclear facilities.
meanings.sent1: The decommission of the nuclear plant was a lengthy process.
meanings.sent2: The decommission of the military base required careful planning.
meanings.sent3: The decommission of the old tank became a tourist attraction.
meanings.sent4: The decommission of the aircraft carrier was a significant event for the navy.
meanings.sent5: The decommission of the missile silo left a void in the landscape.
